timeline.title: Model Y
timeline.description: In March 2020, Tesla began deliveries of its fifth vehicle model, the Model Y crossover.

timeline.title: Model 3
timeline.description: Tesla began selling its fourth vehicle model, the Model 3 sedan, in July 2017. The Model 3 was a cheaper vehicle compared to previous Tesla vehicles, and was intended for the mass market.

timeline.title: Model S
timeline.description: In June the company launched its second car, the Model S luxury sedan.

timeline.comment: In May 2010, Tesla purchased what would later become the Tesla Factory in Fremont, California, from Toyota for $42 million

timeline.title: Roadster
timeline.description:
Prototypes of Tesla's first car, the Roadster, were officially revealed to the public on July 19, 2006, in Santa Monica, California.

Tesla began production of the Roadster in 2008.

By January 2009, Tesla had raised $187 million and delivered 147 cars. Musk had contributed $70 million of his own money to the company.
